Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant; and Israel, whom I have chosen:
Thus saith the LORD that made thee, and formed thee from the womb, <FI>which<Fi> will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob, my servant; and thou, Jesurun, whom I have chosen.
For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring:
And they shall spring up <FI>as<Fi> among the grass, as willows by the water courses.

One shall say, I <FI>am<Fi> the LORD'S; and another shall call <FI>himself<Fi> by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe <FI>with<Fi> his hand unto the LORD, and surname <FI>himself<Fi> by the name of Israel.
Thus saith the LORD the King of Israel, and his redeemer the LORD of hosts; I <FI>am<Fi> the first, and I <FI>am<Fi> the last; and beside me <FI>there is<Fi> no God.
And who, as I, shall call, and shall declare it, and set it in order for me, since I appointed the ancient people? and the things that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.

Fear ye not, neither be afraid: have not I told thee from that time, and have declared <FI>it<Fi>? ye <FI>are<Fi> even my witnesses. Is there a God beside me? yea, <FI>there is<Fi> no God; I know not <FI>any<Fi>.<RF>God; I: Heb. rock, etc<Rf><CM>

They that make a graven image <FI>are<Fi> all of them vanity; and their delectable things shall not profit; and they <FI>are<Fi> their own witnesses; they see not, nor know; that they may be ashamed.<RF>delectable: Heb. desirable<Rf>
Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image <FI>that<Fi> is profitable for nothing?

Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed: and the workmen, they <FI>are<Fi> of men: let them all be gathered together, let them stand up; <FI>yet<Fi> they shall fear, <FI>and<Fi> they shall be ashamed together.

The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals, and fashioneth it with hammers, and worketh it with the strength of his arms: yea, he is hungry, and his strength faileth: he drinketh no water, and is faint.<RF>with the tongs: or, with an axe<Rf>

The carpenter stretcheth out <FI>his<Fi> rule; he marketh it out with a line; he fitteth it with planes, and he marketh it out with the compass, and maketh it after the figure of a man, according to the beauty of a man; that it may remain in the house.

He heweth him down cedars, and taketh the cypress and the oak, which he strengtheneth for himself among the trees of the forest: he planteth an ash, and the rain doth nourish <FI>it<Fi>.<RF>strengtheneth: or, taketh courage<Rf>

Then shall it be for a man to burn: for he will take thereof, and warm himself; yea, he kindleth <FI>it<Fi>, and baketh bread; yea, he maketh a god, and worshippeth <FI>it<Fi>; he maketh it a graven image, and falleth down thereto.
He burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth flesh; he roasteth roast, and is satisfied: yea, he warmeth <FI>himself<Fi>, and saith, Aha, I am warm, I have seen the fire:
And the residue thereof he maketh a god, <FI>even<Fi> his graven image: he falleth down unto it, and worshippeth <FI>it<Fi>, and prayeth unto it, and saith, Deliver me; for thou <FI>art<Fi> my god.
They have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eyes, that they cannot see; <FI>and<Fi> their hearts, that they cannot understand.<RF>shut: Heb. daubed<Rf>

And none considereth in his heart, neither <FI>is there<Fi> knowledge nor understanding to say, I have burned part of it in the fire; yea, also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh, and eaten <FI>it<Fi>: and shall I make the residue thereof an abomination? shall I fall down to the stock of a tree?<RF>considereth…: Heb. setteth to his heart<Rf><RF>the stock…: Heb. that which comes of a tree?<Rf>
He feedeth on ashes: a deceived heart hath turned him aside, that he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, <FI>Is there<Fi> not a lie in my right hand?<CM>
Remember these, O Jacob and Israel; for thou <FI>art<Fi> my servant: I have formed thee; thou <FI>art<Fi> my servant: O Israel, thou shalt not be forgotten of me.
I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.

Sing, O ye heavens; for the LORD hath done <FI>it<Fi>: shout, ye lower parts of the earth: break forth into singing, ye mountains, O forest, and every tree therein: for the LORD hath redeemed Jacob, and glorified himself in Israel.

Thus saith the LORD, thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb, I <FI>am<Fi> the LORD that maketh all <FI>things<Fi>; that stretcheth forth the heavens alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself;
That frustrateth the tokens of the liars, and maketh diviners mad; that turneth wise <FI>men<Fi> backward, and maketh their knowledge foolish;

That confirmeth the word of his servant, and performeth the counsel of his messengers; that saith to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited; and to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be built, and I will raise up the decayed places thereof:<RF>decayed…: Heb. wastes<Rf>
That saith to the deep, Be dry, and I will dry up thy rivers:
That saith of Cyrus, <FI>He is<Fi> my shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure: even saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built; and to the temple, Thy foundation shall be laid.<CM>
